data.title: Jan. 4 tribute to Mel Tormé kicks off Elisabeth Lahti Concert Series
data.meta_description: The jazz ensemble Jonathan Cummings and Friends will present a tribute to the legendary jazz singer Mel Tormé at January 4 at the Peter & Julie Cummings Library in Palm City as part of a four-part concert series underwritten by Elisabeth Lahti. Free tickets are required and may be picked up at the library beginning December 31.
data.text:
By Susan Opasik

The jazz ensemble Jonathan Cummings and Friends will present a tribute to the legendary jazz singer Mel Tormé at 2 p.m. on Saturday, Jan. 4 at the Peter & Julie Cummings Library, 2551 S.W. Matheson Avenue, Palm City, as part of a four-part concert series underwritten by Elisabeth Lahti.

Besides his experience as a backup singer for Barry Manilow, crooner Cummings brings with him trumpeter Mark Green, drummer Claudio Berardi, alto saxophonist Bob Sagnella, bass guitarist Randy Ward and Bud Skiles on keyboard.

Free tickets are required and available for pickup only at the Peter & Julie Cummings Library beginning Tuesday, Dec. 31. Please note the library will be closed Jan. 1.

The next concert in the Elisabeth Lahti Concert Series will be countertenor Terry Barber and Friends on Feb. 1, followed by The Rowdy Micks on March 1 and Paraguayan harpist Marcos Vega with guitarist Clark Hower on April 12.

To learn more about the Martin County Library System, pick up a Library Connection at any Martin County library location, call 772-221-1403, or visit http://www.library.martin.fl.us.

This story is contributed by a member of the community and is neither endorsed nor affiliated with TCPalm.
